website_summaries.verdict: The GPS-equipped Canon PowerShot D20 is a well-built but large rugged camera with a sharp lens. It produces good-looking images at every supported ISO, but isn't the fastest tough camera that we've tested.
cons: Large, even for a rugged camera

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: We are long time Canon camera owners so we bought this when we planned our trip to raft the Grand Canyon. Within days of being on the water the camera became fogged. After that point the camera was unable to take a picture that didn't just look like fog. While the camera was splashed some, it was never submerged at all. Essentially, it failed at its basic task. We watched with sadness as others on the trip with Fuji and other cameras continued to use their waterproof cameras throughout the trip.
customer_reviews.author: M. Younger

customer_reviews.title: Failed, quickly
customer_reviews.text: Great, till it failed. I took my new camera on a Caribbean cruise. Having owned a similar model, I was ultra careful opening the port to download pictures. Eventually I opened the battery port to add a fresh one, on the next use it leaked and has refused to dry out and work. Believe me, I was careful.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great first camera
customer_reviews.text: Still use it while diving. Bought a case so I could go deeper with it. Best in clear waters, like hawaii, because picture quality can get grainy from particulate in the water. Great buy for getting started with underwater photography.
customer_reviews.author: Bronwyn pavia

customer_reviews.title: Video started making click sound for unkown reason
customer_reviews.text: I owned this camera for about a year. I used it lightly, always washed it after being in the water, and did not drop or damage it. After owning it for about one year (used maybe 10 times total), it started making a clicking sound when taking video. I suspect the stabilization mechanism was broken, but turning the stabilization off did not eliminate the clicking sound. I sent it back to the manufacturer for repair, and they wanted to charge me the cost of a new Canon D20 to replace it. The manufacturer did not tell me why it was clicking, did not offer a discount to purchase a new one, and did not provide any other assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!  Takes great pics, durable, long battery life!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Takes great underwater pictures as well as regular pictures. We took it on a family cruise last year (sorry for the late review, but almost a year and a half later, it's still holding up). We've taken it to beaches, pools, water parks, theme parks... and don't have to worry about it getting splashed on. Battery life holds up pretty well, too. Have no complaints except having to be careful that it doesn't accidentally sink. But since it's bright blue, it's easy to find in the even that you drop it. My friend's waterproof camera has a floating strap that I should look into, but it's fine without it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Roni

customer_reviews.title: this camera worked great as a normal point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take on a cruise. this camera worked great as a normal point and shoot. and once we figured out how to change the setting for underwater the images were pretty good. don't make the same mistake i did, spend some time playing with this camera before taking it on a trip. pros- solid and very water proof, great battery life, pretty good color under water cons- the power button is close to the trigger, so its easy to turn the camera off by accident. the leash is almost useless, its heavier than the normal point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: JPB

customer_reviews.title: ... had this camera for 2 years now and am glad I invested in a waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for 2 years now and am glad I invested in a waterproof camera. Throughout my many travels this has been a Godsend. I used to use my regular cameras while traveling and I can't tell you how many have broke due to tiny bits of sand getting into them. I've been an avid Canon camera user for years now and this one is great. If you don't want a GoPro this is a nice alterative. Pros: Durable, lovely color, solid water seal, good battery life Cons: When the lens is wet you NEED something dry to wipe it so that your pictures won't be blurry, size (it's bigger than a normal point and shoot)
customer_reviews.author: Wanderlust510

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I didn't like was the placement of the strap
customer_reviews.text: Have had no issues with this camera in the water! Please with the clarity of pictures when taken underwater. Only thing I didn't like was the placement of the strap, how it just clicked into place. I removed the strap from that piece and actually tied it on to another part of the camera where I felt more comfortable having it hang off my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this camera everywhere, dropped it countless times, gone underwater and in the rain - it's never let me down. This is my go-to rugged camera, eventually I'll need to replace it but just like the last one (canon D10) it never seems to break so I'll probably end up giving it away to a family member so I can upgrade. The HD video is great, there is some shearing and the photo quality is terrible in low light BUT in bright light, a sunny day at the beach or in the pool, I cannot imagine anything better than this camera for quality, ruggedness, or versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bronson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a cruise, for beach and underwater (snorkeling) use. Also purchased a separate floatation strap based on comments here about the strap coming off with unfortunate consequences. Worked very well - no leaks or other problems, although we were careful to soak in freshwater after use in the sea (per the instructions), and also very careful that there was no sand in the battery/SD card seals etc. Underwater pics and videos were pretty good all things considered, definitely met expectations. Outside the water though the picture quality is mediocre, possibly worse than current gen smartphones.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jolly

customer_reviews.title: Promising but flawed
customer_reviews.text: I used the Canon D20 for 10 days before it reported a "Lens Error" and automatically shut itself down. Removing and replacing the battery did not enable the camera to successfully start. It had some problems focusing when not zoomed to minimum focal length, so perhaps that was a warning sign? It did take some very nice pictures under water and image quality (when it focused) was good. The water seals worked as advertised and the camera has a good physical design. I hope Canon can address the manufacturing issue with the lens and turn this into a solid win. For now I am returning this unit and will be turning to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy and useful
customer_reviews.text: This waterproof camera is a nice improvement from Canon's first waterproof digital camera a few years back. It has a wider-angle lens and a bigger display. It can also automatically focus when one zooms in and out while taking a video, something its predecessor (D10) couldn't do. It is more streamlined, although one has to get used to not blocking the lens when taking shots (the D10 was bulbous but had the lens right in the middle, so one's fingers never block it).
customer_reviews.author: Ezra

customer_reviews.title: I loved my camera while on my honeymoon in Roatan
customer_reviews.text: I loved my camera while on my honeymoon in Roatan. However, we came home, took it to a pool party, and....it got wet. We always made sure that everything was locked in place...yet...It ruined all of the pictures that were on the card. We had already backed the pictures up so not a total loss, except for that day. We have tried to dry it out with no luck. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: Powershot waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous fabulous quality pictures ........great little camera. However, we took it on a vacation to the Galapagos just a month after buying it and after only 5 days, the display went out. Thank goodness we had already taken many underwater pictures and videos before it decided to stop working. We were able to take the remaining few days with a smartphone camera, but no more underwater. That's exactly why we bought it was for the underwater capability. Still under warranty so sending it back.....I was very impressed with the quality of what we were able to film, though.
customer_reviews.author: Cybercat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing if you have kids
customer_reviews.text: I have two little girls of 2 and 5 who are at the age of knowing the world. my daughters were fascinated by taking pictures with my phone or with my regular camera, but I was always afraid that they were damaged This camera is so durable and easy to use that we loved it. We went on a trip to the beach and the photos were amazing, especially those that my daughters took. And never worried me water, sand, or if the camera fell to the ground. This camera made ​​the our holiday more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Melisa Aranzazú

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I was fifteen feet up a ladder when the camera fell out of my pocket on to the tarmac. I was sure it was toast, but when I went down to check it it was fine. It's only rated for falling 5 feet or something, so I was amazed and impressed. It works great underwater and fits right in my pocket. The only down side is that the edges of the pictures are not very sharp. If you are more interested in a durable, weatherproof, shock-resistant camera than getting perfectly sharp camera, this one is great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A bit slow and not as crisp as my Canon SLR - but it is small and waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I needed a waterproof camera for a big trip - I went with Canon because have had two Canon Digital SLR cameras that I loved. I don't love this one - its a bit heavier than comparable sized cameras, it is slow and the focus seems just a bit off - probably because of the slowness. But I won't/can't take my SLR's where I take this so I'll keep waiting for a waterproof POS that takes good pictures fast. Note: Enabling the GPS capabilities kill your battery but it is really handy for trip logging.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Failed during a trip
customer_reviews.text: Camera was food while it lasted. Had it a few years but only used it once or twice a year on ocean trip. Out snorkeling yesterday and the screen went blank. Will not come on no matter what I do. It shouldn’t have broken with such a short use life. Very disappointed with the quality/life of the camera from Canon
customer_reviews.author: VA Truck

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with image quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed a water resistant camera for use on a kayak. Did not really need anything totally waterproof, just resistant in case I was splashed or took a spill. Sadly, such a camera does not exist so I looked at waterproof cameras. I chose this one because all of my other cameras are Canon and I've had good luck with them. Unfortunately I did not like the image quality of this camera, so back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Art Chik

customer_reviews.title: The best testament? Husband went kayaking and lost the camera ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my husband for Christmas a couple of years ago. He's a mountaineer and overall outdoors guy who treats camera equipment the way he treats his rugged equipment; ie, not with kid gloves. This camera has stood the test of time and man-handling exceedingly well. The best testament? Husband went kayaking and lost the camera by the banks of the stream at the end of the day. It was dark by then and it couldn't be found. Next morning he went back to look for it, and..... found it, completely submerged in the stream, bouncing against the rocks. Dried off and working perfectly, no loss of photos or usability!!!!
customer_reviews.author: L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, strong outdoor
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to have a relatively small, light but water and shock-resistant camera that I can use if I do not have the option to take a DSLR with me. The quality of the pictures after a DSLR of course is way weaker, the video quality is better if the camera stays still, but does it's work. Shadow and background areas are suffused with noise pixels. Focus is soft, especially in low light. The 5x zoom is nice to use, came handy to me mostly while snorkeling. It is a good quality camera to take for excursions, beach and do not need to be afraid of pouring water on it or drop it accidentally.
customer_reviews.author: heureka

customer_reviews.title: Loved the D10, but this one wasn't waterproof, and Canon wouldn't stand behind it's product.
customer_reviews.text: I had the D10 since it came out and loved it. This one? Stopped working first time in the water- Canon wouldn't replace it (they wanted me to pay to ship it to them for repair- maybe paid by them or me). Fortunately, Amazon's awesome return policy allowed me to return it. Got an Olympus TG3 instead, it has way better reviews anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorgal

customer_reviews.title: Takes great underwater pictures
customer_reviews.text: Takes great underwater pictures. But the fire button is too close to the on/off button. As a result, I frequently turn the camera off instead of taking a picture. Also the lens is to close the left edge of the camera. As a result, I have many pictures with the tip of my index finger in them. I have to always be on guard as to where I place my fingers. I am use to being able to grab and shot a picture. Now I have to double-check the placement of my fingers before I shot. The quality of the pictures is great. But for the price of the camera, I would have expected a better designed camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F. Tillman, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: or when I expect the weather to be bad. It does okay in the water but the ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, waterproof cameras are always a trade off. I carry this one on small boats, or for snorkeling, or when I expect the weather to be bad. It does okay in the water but the picture quality out of the water is by far the worst of any of my various cameras, to include my phone. Bright areas are completely blown out. If you're using it in the water consider a floating wrist strap to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rob J

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot D20
customer_reviews.text: Camera purchased for a recent trip to the Galapagos Islands, but had little time to use it prior to being on location. Camera size very convenient; ability to attach wrist strap for either right- or left-hand use also a plus. Large screen; menus are intuitive; easy to change modes and make adjustments, even under water. Excellent video, both above & under water. Good quality still photos, but with more experimentation using auto, manual, & program modes for exposure, hoping to upgrade that comment to "excellent" quality still photos. So far, "waterproof" claim has held true... no leakage whatsoever after multiple snorkel outings.
customer_reviews.author: marielb

customer_reviews.title: it's underwater quality may have been a bit better than actual
customer_reviews.text: i give it a 3.5 not a full 4.. it's underwater quality may have been a bit better than actual. size wise it's not a small camera.. if you are traveling to seaside, have limitation for room, and would like to take 1 camera only, i'd hesitate to take this for full 1 week time.. if you are specifically going to take underwater pictures yes, you can take this one.. if it's going to be a combination of underwater and other stuff, then next time i figured to take my other canon camera..
customer_reviews.author: AlpAkyildiz

customer_reviews.title: Best underwater camera
customer_reviews.text: Best under water camera I have owned. Better than the Olympus I owned previously. Takes a good underwater pic and a decent out-of-water pic. I have a $1,500 Cannon that takes an amazing pic, so obviously the powershot won't compare to it. Overall, great lil knock around camera to throw in your bag for the beach, boating, and any kind of weather condition. I took it snowboarding and kept it in my pocket. Got some great pics! Took it to the Caribbean and got some cool underwater shots.
customer_reviews.author: elliotte

customer_reviews.title: Great Photos Underwater and On Land
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter who spends a lot of time at the beach (saltwater). It has been reliable and performs very well both underwater and on land. In fact, a photo she took with this camera of a rhino on safari won an international photography competition -- against much more expensive and professional cameras. It is a great buy for the price. She has never used the camera more than 10 feet deep so I cannot comment on it at depths greater than that.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: slow
customer_reviews.text: used it under water in Puerto Rico and it was not as clear as I thought and it was much slower than I had hoped. Missed most of the fish. By the time I had them in view and snapped the shot they were half out of the frame. Ended up using video and am not sure what I did wrong but can't post the video. Wrong format or something. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy I.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera. Used on a few vacations and when ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera. Used on a few vacations and when you are in clear ocean water the pictures come out wonderful. No issues with it yet and on the 2nd year of ownership. If you are a camera junkie and need the best picture in the world this isn't the camera for you. If you good photos with the ability to take it in the water and just have fun then this is a 10/10 for you.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera.
customer_reviews.text: It's great for what it is. Don't expect it to fill the shoes of larger fancier cameras with large zoom lenses and lots of fancy features. My teen daughter says it will be great for her splash parties in the water with her friends. It makes a great wet location back-up camera for my photography business. No fear moving into the wet action. I would think it would be a great hiking and outdoor sporting camera too.
customer_reviews.author: Arts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect vacation camera
customer_reviews.text: Perfect vacation camera! I'm a photographer by trade and dont like bringing my one expensive camera with me on vacation, this let me adjust 80% of my settings (except the lens obviously) but it's WATERPROOF! GOt AMAZING snorkeling & underwater photos and the next day took it to a snowy mountain top! was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Not so good in salt water
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are nice. I couldn't get very good macro shots with it. I'm sure it work fine in fresh water, but I was using it in salt water and it died within in a couple months. Given the salt, just letting it dry out after use wasn't effective. I'd recommend to anyone looking for a waterproof camera in this class and that plans on using it in salt water, to just get a "regular" camera in the same class along with truly waterproof case...maybe two for good measure.
customer_reviews.author: JiCiT

customer_reviews.title: Durable and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this camera after some very quick online research as we were leaving on vacation in three days and had lost our camera. We were pleasantly surprised by the durability, ease of use, and quality of photos. We also used the camera in Belize during snorkeling excursions, it took great underwater pictures. The only downside to this camera was that if you like to set up and take timed photos, you need a tripod. This camera does not sit up well by itself. I would recommend this camera especially if you are active in your travels.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing around with this camera and it seems to do some cool things. When I first opened the box, I was surprised at the size of the camera. I was expecting it to be smaller. It still is small, but my last underwater camera was much smaller. But it is still OK. I have ready many reviews talking about how it would leak. Time will tell. I am taking this thing on vacation in Mexico in a couple of weeks. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN in Denver

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have done about 10 dives now with this camera and the rubberized outside makes it easy to hold, the screen size is awesome and it is durable as well. Very unique shape that is great for gripping. The strap is a well woven, easy to adjust accessory that I had no problem adjusting to even though I am not one who likes strapping equipment in. Video is colorful, pictures are vibrant. I take this camera out to the club, in to the campsite and...of course...underwater. Keep em coming canon!
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: It worked beautifully during my snorkling trip in Jamaica. The photos came out bright and clear! It held up when I banged it against rocks while swimming.. even my 8 year old niece enjoyed using it! It does sink, and fast, so I suggest making sure the strap is snug on your wrist. I also suggest practicing using it in the tub so you can get used to the settings and know what's best to use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

customer_reviews.title: Not WaterProof!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. I used this camera about a dozen times, snorkeling. I tried using it today and it malfunctioned, shut off and would not turn back on. When I got home I opened the battery compartment and water poured out of it. It obviously is not as waterproof as they claim. Very disappointing. Additionally it appears it cannot be returned at this point even though I have only had it 2 months. I would not recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jake73

customer_reviews.title: A decent waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take underwater pictures of fishes. It does not have a lot of features, but the basic functionality is good. I didn't give it all 5 stars because the buttons stopped working after 6 months, but it was repaired promptly under warranty. Here's a nice video I took with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: The Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great underwater photos and video
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a recent trip to Hawaii and we were impressed with the photos and video we were able to take. We got some awesome shots of swimming with sea turtles and fish. We often take video on our DSLR camera at 24 fps and we were looking for an underwater camera that could shoot at the same frame rate, so we were very happy to find this one. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: A. ReneeTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A costly disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was in love with this camera. Above and below water, it took excellent pictures. The video was great when snorkeling.in the Caribbean. However I have not used it extensively since I bought it. I was surprised then, when using it recently while snorkelling off the Bahamas, it simply stopped working. I checked to see if the battery chamber had leaked but there was no trace of water. Nor were there signs that water had entered the lens chamber. I have changed batteries with no results. I have concluded that it is not a reliable nor a durable product.
customer_reviews.author: Perry A.

customer_reviews.title: battery dies in 3 days even without use
customer_reviews.text: Pissed off cause I can't use it, every time I go to use it the battery is dead. I have taken maybe 25 pictures if that on it. I put it aside and 3 days later the battery is dead. Then again, I charged it and 3 days later now it is dead again. This has happened over the past 2 months now. Making me very upset and I cannot get in touch with the seller! I tried but no response
customer_reviews.author: Jacqui75

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a few cameras. However on a fishing trip this summer, my guide had an older version. I had my old canon tucked away in a zip lock bag so it would not get water damage. Trouble was it took some effort to extract from my pocket, remove from the baggie and take a picture. This camera has a unique design - but takes great action shots. Its our new adventure camera- fishing, skiing, hiking - anything outdoors
customer_reviews.author: John Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband. It takes really good pictures. I have a really nice Nikon that I have used for years and I ended up storing it away during our vacation because of how lovely and vivid this camera takes pictures. Didn't tryout the waterproof feature yet but can't wait to do that on our next cruise. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CJmom

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for us. Took this on our honeymoon for in and out of the water shots, everything still seems to be watertight and safe, we just gave it a little rinse with fresh water once we came in from the ocean. We are very happy with this camera and it takes great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: GStylin

customer_reviews.title: a nice compact camera
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a nice compact camera. It really is as tough as advertised too. Soon after I bought it I dropped it 3-4 feet onto a concrete sidewalk and it not only survived, but had so little cosmetic damage I can barely find it if I'm looking. The image quality was a little better with the D10, but the size and shape of the D20 is much better, with exception of the attachment point of the strap. The location doesn't allow it to be placed upright on a flat surface with the stap's lug attached. Thankfully this issue seems to have been resolved with the D30 as far as I can tell from the pictures of the new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Hutcheson

customer_reviews.title: Good camera but may need some improvment
customer_reviews.text: It's very good camera by this price, I bought it for my Cancun trip, good picture and video quality, I have no problem at all use it under water, fresh or salt, but only problem I have is the flash light, it only has 2 options AUTO or OFF, the AUTO sometimes not very smart, why can't have an flash ON option? also the camera video play back don't have speaker, BTW the software won't let me change the download directory.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Guan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera, So Happy With It
customer_reviews.text: This camera is possibly the best purchase I made last year. My family went on vacation to the Caribbean and it did everything and more for me and it worked so easily! I would buy it again and again but it's so sturdy and can take a hit so well that I don't think I will ever have to. I would reccommend that you take it in a pool with you or somewhere you can fiddle with it prior to any adventure just so you know what you like. On a side note I took a video of a puffer fish while there and it might be the best video I have ever taken :)
customer_reviews.author: Anna H.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera!! We go to the lake a lot, and I always want to take pictures, but I am scared to use my iphone or my Nikon D3000 close to water!! This camera is so much fun, and it takes great pictures. I have taken pictures under water several times, and it works great!! Most of the time, I am in the water, taking pictures of people (and dogs) jumping off the dock. I am very pleased, and can't wait for summer time again!!
customer_reviews.author: Jo R.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for a trip to Hawaii and it worked flawlessly. I used it in fresh water and salt, no problems, great pictures and video. The controls were easy to use while snorkeling. I used the camera in conjunction with a floaty device just in case the camera slipped from my hands in deep water, but I kept the provided wrist strap on and that didn't happen. I would recommend this camera to any novice or casual shutter bug.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: Big but great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because of the waterproof option. It can stand more than the equivalent from Sony although it is bigger. I have dropped the camera and I have taken it to the ocean to take pictures while snorkeling, the picture quality is great as it is in every cannon product. It is on the bulky side so don't buy it if you want it to fit in your back pocket. One thing I don't like from the camera is that it will not stand still because of the wrist cord connector so the screen will get scratched.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: It works great in the water and seems very solid
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera because it is waterproof and shockproof and it is definitely both of those. It works great in the water and seems very solid. If you want this camera for features it is not the one for you. It has very rudimentary functionality not the least of which is only two flash settings, off and automatic. I love this camera because I'm going to take it with me everywhere and I think it will hold up to any treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: great pictures!
customer_reviews.text: Was a little scared buying this camera due to the reviews. Spent 10 days in Mexico and this never left my wrist. No leaking, great pictures!! The only thing I can complain about is that I didn't read the directions like I should of and discovered ways to take great pics after the fact. Read the information!!
customer_reviews.author: Kbecker

customer_reviews.title: Leaked but they replaced it
customer_reviews.text: I had it leak on the second use and stop working. I sent it to the Canon repair and they shipped me a new one on warranty despite saying they don't cover liquid damage. I just wonder if it's going to leak again. Besides that issue, the pictures were good but not great. It's best in a wet or dusty environment where you wouldn't take your regular camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It's been a month, and the camera has water ...
customer_reviews.text: It's been a month, and the camera has water inside the camera and will not work, I've spent 30 minutes clicking around trying to find a contact number or person or some way to get this fixed or something. No luck. My only option so far is to click return, to which it tells me I'm past the 30 days (by 2 days).
customer_reviews.author: bexbunny

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Used this at great wolf lodge, took great photos up until It started getting water on it. Some of my pictures had blurry marks from were there was water on the lens but I think that's kind of expected. I also took this to a paint party and it took awesome pictures! It even got some paint on it but I just washed it off and it was fine!
customer_reviews.author: Jaden

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera. The undersea mode is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. The undersea mode is amazing! I bought it for my honeymoon trip in Maldives. I took video while snorkeling with it, it was too white/light without using the undersea mode. The second time I remember turn on the undersea mode then the pictures and videos are perfect. I can see the fishes are as colorful as I see them by eyes.
customer_reviews.author: EEPrincess

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for Underwater Cameras!
customer_reviews.text: Took it to Mexico for my honeymoon. A professional scuba photographer even stated this was a great camera. Love it, Love It, LOVE IT!!! I had no problems. I learned I just needed to keep the lens toward the fish and bottom of the ocean to keep the focus for the photo in the water. I had to learn to be a quick shot! We got several wonderful photos while snorkeling! And works just as wonderful outside of the water. Great color in the photos and ZOOM works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Danks

customer_reviews.title: Good camea, worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Brought this camera on a very long trip to both Koreas, Hong Kong, and during songkran in thailand. It held up wonderfully even while getting covered in tapioca starch and water all day long! Highly recommend shelling out the extra bucks for this unit. It IS however a bit clunky, but if you have larger hands it feels pretty good!
customer_reviews.author: elementsquared

customer_reviews.title: best point and shoot ever!
customer_reviews.text: wow - i love canon cameras (i have canon 60D) and, this one is just amazing. I take it with me to every vacation i have. Mexico, NJ shore - anywhere there is water - i use this camera in and out. Great underwater pictures and videos! And, just as a camera, on dry land! :) Thanks! Love the product and totally recommend it! and i did read a lot of reviews about other brands. This one wins by far!
customer_reviews.author: iReview4U

customer_reviews.title: Impulse buy
customer_reviews.text: And turns out I love it! I've never spent so much on a camera before and I was having second thoughts straight away but I took it to Hawaii with me and I LOVED it. For an amateur like me I got some incredible shots, under water and also out and about. It's so easy to use and I'm incredibly pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Super durable and takes awesome pics!
customer_reviews.text: We love this camera. Super durable. Have had it for over a year now. It's been in sand, oceans, rain, volcanoes and hot sun. It's everything it's advertised to be and it takes awesome pictures. It can sink pretty quickly though. We bought the kit with it that comes with the flotilla, carabbeaner strap, etc. and it's perfect. Gives peace of mind and kept the camera floating right along with us on snorkeling trips. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer DeSaegher

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great pictures
customer_reviews.text: This is the first underwater camera that I have owned that takes good pictures: in water, out of water and in the evening. Love that its start-up time is quick and that it has GPS. Takes a little while to acclimate to the buttons, as the on/off button is on the top of the camera right next to the shutter button (my only gripe).
customer_reviews.author: Blues&Cheese

customer_reviews.title: The quality of photos is better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Serves it's purpose as a waterproof and underwater camera for float trips with the family. The quality of photos is better than expected. The buttons are a little confusing... everyone shuts it off when attempting to take a photo. Very non-intuitive, but can be gotten used to.
customer_reviews.author: GrylEe

customer_reviews.title: It takes pretty decent photos but not quite as good as my ...
customer_reviews.text: Has not leaked. It takes pretty decent photos but not quite as good as my old Canon. Overall I am very happy with it though. I take it kayaking and have taken pictures of the manatees. It has been thrown around in the kayak quite a bit and still survived. I do know take it deep, just snorkeling. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy D

customer_reviews.title: I love this Water Proof Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very good resolution it is all that you need if you need take pictures under water with very good quality. 5x optical zoom its enough if you want to take a pictures making snorkel. Strong design to supports falls or knockings. The camera comes with a internal GPS in order to take geo-refered pictures its a very cool feature.
customer_reviews.author: Manfredo

customer_reviews.title: Really nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Kodak Easy Share sport 123 and the improvement is signifficant. I have several Cannon cameras and had been waiting for a replacement for the D10 and I am really pleased with the D20. The quality of the pictures it takes compared to the Kodak in the same conditions is much better. It is everything I had hoped for, perfect for me. I do a good amount of snorkling and with good light this takes very sharp pictures.
customer_reviews.author: JB4kids

customer_reviews.title: Replacing one exactly like it
customer_reviews.text: To replace the one that died on day 2 of vacation that I've used for 3 years. Easy to use, good quality and perfect size. I like this camera so much I'm doing an exact replacement. Wish I knew how to get the first one repaired so I'd have two.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Good photos, but slow and bulky
customer_reviews.text: Canon D20 good features: rugged waterproof good quality stills good quality video OK zoom range with no lens pop-out Bad features: slow at multiple shots slow focus bulky (I understand must be to be rugged & waterproof)
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Everything I have come to expect from Canon
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Canon digital camera and my first waterproof camera. Takes great quality photos and HD video, controls & menus are easy to use and familiar if you have experience with other Canon cameras. Even if you don't use it underwater, it is great for taking pics around the water in general. Had it on a rafting trip and out on the boat so far, great to be able to jump in the water with it and snap photos while throwing the Frisbee around, etc. I highly recommend purchasing a float strap so it doesn't sink if you accidentally drop it.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian S. Kniahynycky

customer_reviews.title: NOT waterproof = But Canon replaced the failed camera with a refurbished one
customer_reviews.text: After about 5 uses in the water (at snorkeling depth) water penetration occurred. I meticulously followed instructions for making sure the two doors are properly closed. I've always been happy with Canon products but this one is a real disappointment. Steer clear of this if you're thinking about using this underwater. Now it's a $300 piece of junk UPDATE - camera was sent back to Canon. Initially, I got a letter indicating that they'd charge me $190 to look at it. I called and provided my purchase receipt and am now in possession of a refurbished, but working, camera. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Have purchased two of these and both took great pictures as long as they worked
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased two of these and both took great pictures as long as they worked! That is the problem, other campers have lasted me years with the same care, but this model just didn't last very long and failed mid vacation and days lost when great pictures could have been taken. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Carla Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Bought for snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: We used this camera on a cruise we took in May 2013. We LOVE it. The picture quality is amazing underwater and above. We love the big viewing screen. We used it in salt water and just washed it in fresh water when we were done for the day. Haven't had any problems with it yet. Very durable and on the heavier side. I'd recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hickok

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality product. I have used this camera a lot while kayaking. The only negative thing is the image stabilizer when using the video on the ocean, a little shaky.
customer_reviews.author: Fireblade

customer_reviews.title: really a waste..
customer_reviews.text: i bought this camera on may 2014 and i had it shipped to a friend of mine in usa who brought it to me as i live in egypt and when i used the camera under water i noticed that it wouldnt work and when i came out of water i noticed there is water in the camera :((( and cannon egypt refused to take it as it was bought in usa i contacted cannon usa and they refused to take it into fix as they dont accept pacakges from outside the states ....really a waste ...
customer_reviews.author: shymaa elsayed mohamed el mult

customer_reviews.title: Great for underwater photos
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera to use in/near water, or in situations where there's a risk of getting the camera wet. However, the colors seemed a little off, but it was easily fixed on the computer. Overall not the best quality photos, but worked great for our trip to the Galapagos Islands last spring. Wouldn't have gone without it.
customer_reviews.author: estates

customer_reviews.title: no regrets!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes pictures so clear. The underwater function is also wonderful and takes clear pictures. Besides the underwater feature, I really like the vivid function that makes your pictures pop, and the other various functions I have not seen in other camera brands. I have no regrets about purchasing this camera. It's really awesome! The only downside i'll say is that it's a little big but it's nothing to worry about. Also, I expected the camera to have a sport (fast movement) feature. Mabe it does and I have not searched for it properly. I'll buy no other camera brand besides canon.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha Bascombe

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well, easy to use underwater!
customer_reviews.text: Works very good under water, used it while snorkeling on a cruise and both photos and video came out great. The best noticeable plus is the ability to use the controls and see the screen under water with a mask on.
customer_reviews.author: Larry B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera. Takes great shots both above and under ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. Takes great shots both above and under the water!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: looking for the waterproof camera? THIS IS IT!
customer_reviews.text: i got this for my vacation coming up in about 6 weeks and while having it in hand, i've been testing it. took lots of shots of my furry babies and it came out like a professional took it! it was awesome! it's a tad bit heavy but it's worth every penny i spent! :) looking forward to taking pictures on my vacation! :D
customer_reviews.author: Chepiina

customer_reviews.title: was easy to charge and I think it feels good in ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, it is everything I wanted in an underwater durable camera. It is a gorgeous color, was easy to charge and I think it feels good in my hand. It does not feel slippery to me at all. Looking forward to using it on our cruise.
customer_reviews.author: cmc234

customer_reviews.title: Not good around beach with sand
customer_reviews.text: 1. Not good around beach with sand. Fine sand gets into the small gap and caused shutter button to stuck. 2. Taking under water is OK, but if you try to take picture out of the water and lens still wet, picture is blurry due to water droplet still on the lens. Must be a way around this problem. I bought various water proof camera brand every year for beach vacation and none seems to work well or last more than 1 vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it's broken?
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this camera from the U.S. and had it shipped to me overseas so I can't really send it back. I was disappointed to find that the flash does not work at all and when I try to turn the camera to take pictures vertically the screen goes dark. The picture still takes, but I can't see what I'm taking. Also, I was surprised how heavy and bulky it is. I know it is shockproof and waterproof but I think I will only use it in situations where I need it to be waterproof (like snorkeling) and buy another smaller camera for more everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: i love this little camera, i actually took it to vegas to test it for the weekend and took great photos. then my weenie dog is doing swimming therapy and the vet was hoping to see how he was doing underwater so i asked if i could bring the camera and the quality of the video is great! definitely recommend the product
customer_reviews.author: DariosaurusRex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a gift for my wife. She really loves this product. She loves the way it looks and the quality of the pictures it takes. She especially likes taking photos of fast action shots while riding on the back of my Harley-Davidson motorcycle. All of her fast action shots have been clear with very good color. She doesn't get impressed easily but loves this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Bustinduy

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof camera
customer_reviews.text: It is really waterproof! And, take nice photos. We bought this for a snorkeling/sailing trip and we were surprised at how well it worked. We had one instance where the LCD screen fogged up while we were hiking, but it cleared itself up after a bit. We've used it on land and it takes some nice photos.
customer_reviews.author: kcrawford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, got it for my wife. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: John Yarborough

customer_reviews.title: Love this Camera !!!
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was fast. Love this camera. Just used it on a 7 day Western Caribbean cruise. Used it at Dunns River Falls, Jamaica in the water. Great shots. Also used it underwater snorkeling in Labadee Haiti and Cozumel Mexico. Incredibly easy to use and great underwater shots. Took about 2 minutes to teach the wife to use it. Very easy. Battery life is very good also. Didn't have to recharge until day 6 on the cruise. Glad I bought it, would but it again and will recommend to all friends. Thanks Canon and Thanks Amazon. Very Happy !!
customer_reviews.author: Donna J.

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it takes the best pictures I've ever seen but it doesn't take the ...
customer_reviews.text: I found myself pressing the off button instead the button to take a picture often, because of the location of the buttons being so close together. Other than that it worked as advertised. I don't think it takes the best pictures I've ever seen but it doesn't take the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: The best small camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for my teenager to take to Europe. You just would not believe the beautiful quality pictures that he was able to take. A professional photographer mention that he thought the pictures were taken with an expensive multi- lens camera.Slips easily into a day bag too!!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Hiott

customer_reviews.title: Water Proof Camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a great bargain and is very efficient. We still have a lot to learn about it. It is cute, small and very effective. We needed a smaller camera with zoom power and that was water proof. It actually takes pictures under water and was a true bargain. We are excited and satisfied. Amazon is great!
customer_reviews.author: Tucker

customer_reviews.title: nice camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a preliminary review since I just bought the camera for my wife at Xmas, but so far very pleased. Excellent features, large and clear screen, and the photos are very sharp with or without flash. I'll update once I've had it in the water, since I bought it mainly for the waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: pet doctor

customer_reviews.title: so far the camera is great. it's already been tubing with us and the ...
customer_reviews.text: so far the camera is great. it's already been tubing with us and the pictures were really nice. i also used a floating thing that i purchased separately for it - which was really good because it got dropped in the water.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: It worked for about 18 pictures. The camera went ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked for about 18 pictures. The camera went black and had an error message about the lense not working properly. I didn't use it for a couple of months till on vacation. Please make sure you test your products in time to receive a full refund after some time it does change.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Mamita

customer_reviews.title: Not too happy with this product and would never buy another one
customer_reviews.text: Second time I used the camera I checked all seals and the camera was sealed tight and half thru my swim which the camera did not go below 2 feet of water it froze and does not work any more. After getting home and looking at the camera it was evident that it had moisture inside the camera. Not too happy with this product and would never buy another one!! Hope I can get it fixed and or my money back. SAD!!!!! SAD!!!!! SAD!!!!!!!!!! John Griffey
customer_reviews.author: John Griffey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!!
customer_reviews.text: My hubby got me this camera for our cruise. I took over 400 pics and video and a lot were underwater. Love that its compact and easy to carry around but still does tons of things-zoom and go from underwater to normal. I even hit a rail on the boat and the camera was fine! Hubby even took video going down big slide on ship. Highly recommend this camera!! Great job Canon!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Good quality pics, tough and waterproof, lots of pro-style settings. Luckily exposure compensation is one setting because in any mode, it overexposes everytime. I keep it at -1/3 or -2/3 always.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my new D20. Bought it last year for a trip to the beach. It worked great, both above and below salt water. Both pics and video turn out great. Going on our first cruise in a month and I can't wait to go snorkeling around the Bahama Islands with it. Wanting to capture some wonderful memories with my family.
customer_reviews.author: 'Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Failed Me Twice In Snorkeling
customer_reviews.text: I regret to report it has failed me twice during simple snorkeling. Last year It failed in St. John, USVI, after a few uses. Canon replaced it. Last month it failed again after one snorkeling use in French Polynesia. So I have given up on it. On the other hand, my Canon A620 has been a reliable travel workhorse for years.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Devino

customer_reviews.title: i've dropped it and snorkeled with it
customer_reviews.text: I drop things all the time. This has survived a trip to Thailand, Malaysia, and some weekend road trips. Takes great outdoor pictures and good (not great) indoor pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot D20 12.1 MP CMOS Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens a 3.0-Inch LCD and GPS Tracking (Blue) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Canon 6145B100 PowerShot D20 12.1MP Outdoor Camera can handle it all. This camera is waterproof to 33 feet, temperature-resistant from 14°F to 104°F, shockproof up to 5.0 feet, and equipped with a GPS tracker. Slim and sturdy with a highly visible color layout, its buttons are operable even with gloved hands. Spectacular image quality is ensured with the 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor for excellent low-light performance, and a 5x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle Lens that brings excitement to your imaging. A single touch and you will be shooting incredibly vivid 1080p Full HD Video with full zooming capability. Lots of optional accessories take you deeper underwater and more.What's in the box: Canon PowerShot D20 Waterproof Digital Camera (Blue), NB-6L Lithium-Ion Battery Pack (3.7v, 1000mAh), CB-2LY Battery Charger for Canon NB-6L Lithium-Ion Battery, IFC-400PCU USB Interface Cable, Wrist Strap WS-DC8, Strap Mount, Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM and Limited 1-Year Warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

LET THE ADVENTURE BEGIN
Outdoorsy, adventurous types need to look no further for a camera that can handle it all. The PowerShot D20 digital camera is waterproof to 33 feet, temperature-resistant from 14°F to 104°F, shockproof up to 5.0 feet, and equipped with a GPS tracker. Slim and sturdy with a highly visible color layout, its buttons are operable even with gloved hands. Spectacular image quality is ensured with the 12.1 Megapixel High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor for excellent low-light performance, and a 5x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle Lens that brings excitement to your imaging. A single touch and you'll be shooting incredibly vivid 1080p Full HD Video with full zooming capability. Lots of optional accessories take you deeper underwater and more. 

PUT THE POWERSHOT D20 TO THE TEST
WATERPROOF, SHOCKPROOF AND FREEZE-RESISTANT DESIGN 
Canon created the PowerShot D20 to be the tough, practical companion you'll want to bring on all your outdoor adventures, making it possible to capture truly impressive stills and video while doing what you love. Scuba dive, snorkel, paddle surf and more: the camera is waterproof all the way to 33 feet. Performance is fast and reliable in temperatures from 14° to 104°F, so it's safe for everything from winter sports to summer hiking. Shockproof up to 5.0 feet, the PowerShot D20 is also able to survive the accidental falls and bumps inherent to mountaineering, biking, and other outdoor activities.

EXPERIENCE THE POWER
CANON HS SYSTEM
The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you take bright, clear photos in an even wider range of shooting situations. Beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The system is the result of two technologies brought together in PowerShot cameras: a high-sensitivity imaging sensor, which is able to capture more light; and the DIGIC Image Processor, which actively reduces noise with high-speed image processing. The 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor in the PowerShot D20 incorporates advanced light reception technology that enhances sensitivity. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor provides a major boost in noise reduction, expanding the usable ISO range to an amazing high of 3200. The Canon HS SYSTEM takes the frustration out of low-light shooting, delivering clear, blur-free images.

DIGIC 4 IMAGE PROCESSOR 
Canon DIGIC Image Processors have set the standard for functionality and performance since their groundbreaking introduction in 1999. With each successive generation, DIGIC processors have brought elevated performance and powerful new features to PowerShot digital cameras. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor has ushered in a new level of picture quality and accelerated processing, making possible features such as high-speed continuous shooting, HD video and Face Detection Self-timer.

MEMORABLE MOMENTS IN SPECTACULAR FULL HD
CANON FULL HD VIDEO ADVANTAGE 
In addition to the Canon HS SYSTEM, the combination of the advanced CMOS sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor in the PowerShot D20 makes it possible to shoot crisp, clear high definition video. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot spectacular 1080p Full HD that you can later watch on your HDTV or download to your computer to share with family and friends. In addition to being able to shoot Full HD 1080p video at 24* frames per second, the PowerShot D20 can also shoot 720p HD video at 30** frames per second.

DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON, WIND FILTER FEATURE AND OPTICAL ZOOM FOR EASY VIDEO CAPTURE 
It's never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. The PowerShot D20 has a dedicated movie button that lets you start and stop recording instantly. There is no need to go through layers of menus or operate switches or dials to switch to and from video recording mode. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want. The PowerShot D20 also incorporates an electronic wind filter, which suppresses wind noise that can muffle or distort the sound. And unlike less sophisticated point-and-shoot cameras, the PowerShot D20 lets you use the full range of optical zoom when you're shooting a video.

HDTV PLAYBACK VIA HDMI OUTPUT AND CEC 
It's easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot D20. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable. And because the PowerShot D20 supports HDMI-CEC technology, you'll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TV's remote control. (CECConsumer Electronic Control – is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)

IFRAME
With the PowerShot D20, you can also shoot video in the AppleÂ® iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions.

DYNAMIC IMAGES, EASY TO SHOOT AND REVIEW
5X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH 28MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS 
The PowerShot D20's optical brilliance is a perfect match for the outdoor adventures the camera's tough design supports. The 5x Optical Zoom (operable during video recording, too) brings wildlife and other difficult-to-approach subjects close. The 28mm Wide-Angle Lens (35mm equivalent: 24â€“140mm) makes all your shots more dynamic, and allows you to capture landscapes with their magisterial breadth intact.





PURECOLOR SYSTEM LCD 
Many LCD screens on the market today use a striped arrangement of dots that works great for text and menus, but is not ideal for imagery. The PowerShot D20's PureColor System LCD uses a delta arrangement of dots, which works better for the organic nature of photos and videos, allowing you to review your images with exceptional clarity with rich, true-to-life color. The PureColor System LCD is also ultra-durable to withstand heavy use in all sorts of conditions. Just as importantly, it offers clarity you won't find elsewhere. Outdoors in sunlight, color is faithfully reproduced, while a high contrast ratio ensures that you'll see exactly what you're shooting from any viewing angle. This makes it easy to frame shots quickly in tight situations.

OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER
Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon's Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct for unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.

THE IDEAL TRAVELING COMPANION
GPS TECHNOLOGY
The PowerShot D20 digital camera is equipped with Global Positioning System (GPS)* technology. Now you can travel the world and let the camera automatically record the locations** and local times of your stills and videos. The camera can also use the GPS unit to automatically set the exact time. You can maximize the usefulness of the GPS feature by using the special bundled Map Utility software that makes it fun to share the memories of your world adventures. In addition to displaying all your photos' locations on a world map, the camera's GPS system can also track your route from photo to photo – a great way to visualize each trip! You can also create and share custom maps and personal mini-travel guides with friends and family members.
*In certain countries and regions, the use of GPS may be restricted. Therefore, be sure to use GPS in accordance with the laws and regulations of your country or region. Be particularly careful when traveling outside your home country. As a signal is received from GPS satellites, take sufficient measures when using in locations where the use of electronics is regulated.
This software uses Google Maps for displaying maps.
** GPS tracking does not work underwater.

A STEADY IMAGE IS A BEAUTIFUL IMAGE
INTELLIGENT IS
The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills.

Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement.

Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting.

Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking.

Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified.

Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed.


TAKE THE FUN EVEN FURTHER
OPTIONAL ACCESSORIES 
A full range of optional accessories designed specifically for the PowerShot D20 take its fun and functionality to new heights. A Waterproof Case and Float are perfect for shooting in deeper waters down to 131 feet. A Carabiner Strap and Shoulder Strap keep the camera at hand during biking, climbing, hiking or any physical activity. A Silicone Jacket and Soft Case provide protection from the elements without adding extra weight.
feature_bullets: Intelligent IS picks best of six modes for the shooting conditions
Waterproof to 33 feet, temperature from 14-104 degrees fahrenheit
12.1 MP Canon HS SYSTEM with a High-Sensitivity CMOS sensor, DIGIC 4 Image Processor
5x Optical Zoom with 28mm wide angle lens
3.0-inch Pure Color System LCD for easy viewing
GPS tracker to record image locations on a map via Canon's software (does not work under water)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars541 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
